definition: crash/breakdown (of social values etc)/burst/to crumble/to collapse
to collapse/to fall into ruins/death of king or emperor/demise
bad/spoiled/broken/to break down/(suffix) to the utmost
see 禮崩樂壞|礼崩乐坏[li3 beng1 yue4 huai4]

sentences.english: S. computers have had zero downtime.
The Harvester fell to his blasterfire, which caused the Reaper to collapse.
sentences.chinese: 采集器被他的炮火击坏，这也导致了收割器的崩坏。

sentences.english: This is not normally an issue that needs professional treatment by a veterinarian.
sentences.chinese: 小小的崩坏通常不需要兽医来为貂儿提供专业的诊疗。

definition: talus slide/to crumble (of scree slope)/to collapse/landslide

to destroy/to damage/to ruin/to defame/to slander
variant of 毀|毁[hui3]/to defame/to slander
(of dreams, hopes etc) to vanish/to evaporate/(of a person) to become disillusioned/disillusionment
the design of a character (in games, manga etc) (abbr. for 人物設定|人物设定)/(fig.) (a celebrity or other public figure's) image in the eyes of the public/public persona
